attributes.action: Publish the detailed accounts of the UK Test And Trace programme
attributes.additional_details: I believe that this budget is excessive; I cannot understand what large assets would need to be procured which would require such a large budget.  The sheer amount is comparable to the GDP of a small country...  I would like answers as to how my taxpayer funds are being spent
attributes.background: I would like to see the proper breakdown of exactly what the £37 Billion budget for the programme was used for, to satisfy myself and interested others that taxpayers' funds were used properly.

rejection.details:
You can find out how to make a freedom of information request here:  
https://www.gov.uk/make-a-freedom-of-information-request 

In the meantime you may like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Hold a public inquiry into spending on test and trace': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555502

'Launch a judge-led public inquiry into the Covid-19 pandemic': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577292

'Remove private companies from the Covid-19 NHS Test and Trace system': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551648

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
